Package org.opengrok.indexer.analysis

Class AnalyzerGuru

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opengrok.indexer.analysis.AnalyzerGuru
  • public class AnalyzerGuru
extends Object
    Manages and provides Analyzers as needed. Please see this page for a great description of the purpose of the AnalyzerGuru. Created on September 22, 2005
    Author:
    Chandan

    • Method Detail

      • getVersionNo

        public static long getVersionNo()
        Gets a version number to be used to tag documents examined by the guru so that AbstractAnalyzer selection can be re-done later if a stored version number is different from the current implementation or if guru factory registrations are modified by the user to change the guru operation.

        The static part of the version is bumped in a release when e.g. new FileAnalyzerFactory subclasses are registered or when existing FileAnalyzerFactory subclasses are revised to target more or different files.

        Returns:
        a value whose lower 32-bits are a static value 20201003_00 for the current implementation and whose higher-32 bits are non-zero if addExtension(java.lang.String, AnalyzerFactory) or addPrefix(java.lang.String, AnalyzerFactory) has been called.

      • getAnalyzerVersionNo

        public static long getAnalyzerVersionNo​(String fileTypeName)
        Gets a version number according to a registered FileAnalyzer.getVersionNo() for a fileTypeName according to FileAnalyzer.getFileTypeName().
        Parameters:
        fileTypeName - a defined instance
        Returns:
        a registered value or Long.MIN_VALUE if fileTypeName is unknown

      • addPrefix

        public static void addPrefix​(String prefix,
                             AnalyzerFactory factory)
        Instruct the AnalyzerGuru to use a given analyzer for a given file prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the file prefix to add
        factory - a factory which creates the analyzer to use for the given extension (if you pass null as the analyzer, you will disable the analyzer used for that extension)

      • addExtension

        public static void addExtension​(String extension,
                                AnalyzerFactory factory)
        Instruct the AnalyzerGuru to use a given analyzer for a given file extension.
        Parameters:
        extension - the file-extension to add
        factory - a factory which creates the analyzer to use for the given extension (if you pass null as the analyzer, you will disable the analyzer used for that extension)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if extension contains a period

      • getLangMap

        public static LangMap getLangMap()
        Gets an unmodifiable view of the language mappings resulting from addExtension(String, AnalyzerFactory) and addPrefix(String, AnalyzerFactory) merged with default language mappings of OpenGrok's analyzers.

      • getAnalyzer

        public static AbstractAnalyzer getAnalyzer()
        Get the default Analyzer.
        Returns:
        default FileAnalyzer

      • getAnalyzer

        public static AbstractAnalyzer getAnalyzer​(String fileTypeName)
        Gets an analyzer for the specified fileTypeName if it accords with a known FileAnalyzer.getFileTypeName().
        Parameters:
        fileTypeName - a defined name
        Returns:
        a defined instance if known or otherwise null

      • getAnalyzer

        public static AbstractAnalyzer getAnalyzer​(InputStream in,
                                           String file)
                                    throws IOException
        Get an analyzer suited to analyze a file. This function will reuse analyzers since they are costly.
        Parameters:
        in - Input stream containing data to be analyzed
        file - Name of the file to be analyzed
        Returns:
        An analyzer suited for that file content
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while accessing the data in the input stream.

      • returnAnalyzers

        public static void returnAnalyzers()
        Free resources associated with all registered analyzers.

      • populateDocument

        public void populateDocument​(org.apache.lucene.document.Document doc,
                             File file,
                             String path,
                             AbstractAnalyzer fa,
                             Writer xrefOut)
                      throws IOException,
                             InterruptedException
        Populate a Lucene document with the required fields.
        Parameters:
        doc - The document to populate
        file - The file to index
        path - Where the file is located (from source root)
        fa - The analyzer to use on the file
        xrefOut - Where to write the xref (possibly null)
        Throws:
        IOException - If an exception occurs while collecting the data
        InterruptedException - if a timeout occurs

      • writeXref

        public static void writeXref​(AnalyzerFactory factory,
                             Reader in,
                             Writer out,
                             Definitions defs,
                             Annotation annotation,
                             Project project)
                      throws IOException
        Write a browse-able version of the file.
        Parameters:
        factory - The analyzer factory for this file type
        in - The input stream containing the data
        out - Where to write the result
        defs - definitions for the source file, if available
        annotation - Annotation information for the file
        project - Project the file belongs to
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while creating the output

      • writeDumpedXref

        public static void writeDumpedXref​(String contextPath,
                                   AnalyzerFactory factory,
                                   Reader in,
                                   Writer out,
                                   Definitions defs,
                                   Annotation annotation,
                                   Project project)
                            throws IOException
        Writes a browse-able version of the file transformed for immediate serving to a web client.
        Parameters:
        contextPath - the web context path for Util.dumpXref(java.io.Writer, java.io.Reader, java.lang.String)
        factory - the analyzer factory for this file type
        in - the input stream containing the data
        out - a defined instance to write
        defs - definitions for the source file, if available
        annotation - annotation information for the file
        project - project the file belongs to
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while creating the output

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • findByFileTypeName

        public static AnalyzerFactory findByFileTypeName​(String fileTypeName)
        Finds a FileAnalyzerFactory for the specified FileAnalyzer.getFileTypeName().
        Parameters:
        fileTypeName - a defined instance
        Returns:
        a defined instance or null

      • findFactory

        public static AnalyzerFactory findFactory​(String factoryClassName)
                                   throws ClassNotFoundException,
                                          IllegalAccessException,
                                          InstantiationException,
                                          NoSuchMethodException,
                                          InvocationTargetException
        Find a FileAnalyzerFactory with the specified class name. If one doesn't exist, create one and register it. Allow specification of either the complete class name (which includes the package name) or the simple name of the class.
        Parameters:
        factoryClassName - name of the factory class
        Returns:
        a file analyzer factory
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if there is no class with that name
        ClassCastException - if the class is not a subclass of FileAnalyzerFactory
        IllegalAccessException - if the constructor cannot be accessed
        InstantiationException - if the class cannot be instantiated
        NoSuchMethodException - if no-argument constructor could not be found
        InvocationTargetException - if the underlying constructor throws an exception

      • getFactoryClass

        public static Class<?> getFactoryClass​(String simpleName)
        Get Analyzer factory class using class simple name.
        Parameters:
        simpleName - which may be either the factory class simple name (eg. CAnalyzerFactory), the analyzer name (eg. CAnalyzer), or the language name (eg. C)
        Returns:
        the analyzer factory class, or null when not found.

      • find

        public static AnalyzerFactory find​(InputStream in,
                                   String file)
                            throws IOException
        Finds a suitable analyser class for file name. If the analyzer cannot be determined by the file extension, try to look at the data in the InputStream to find a suitable analyzer. Use if you just want to find file type.
        Parameters:
        in - The input stream containing the data
        file - The file name to get the analyzer for
        Returns:
        the analyzer factory to use
        Throws:
        IOException - If a problem occurred while reading the data

      • find

        public static AnalyzerFactory find​(String file)
        Finds a suitable analyser class for file name.
        Parameters:
        file - The file name to get the analyzer for
        Returns:
        the analyzer factory to use

      • find

        public static AnalyzerFactory find​(InputStream in)
                            throws IOException
        Finds a suitable analyzer class for the data in this stream.
        Parameters:
        in - The stream containing the data to analyze
        Returns:
        the analyzer factory to use
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while reading data from the stream
